abstract: Two researchers warn that the entry of big companies like Microsoft and Google into the field of electronic health records could alter the practice of clinical research and raise new challenges to privacy.
snippet: Two researchers warn that the entry of big companies like Microsoft and Google into the field of electronic health records could alter the practice of clinical research and raise new challenges to privacy.
lead_paragraph: In an article in The New England Journal of Medicine, two leading researchers warn that the entry of big companies like Microsoft and Google into the field of personal health records could drastically alter the practice of clinical research and raise new challenges to the privacy of patient records.

headline.main: Warning on Storage of Health Records
headline.print_headline: Safeguards Sought on Web Health Data

abstract: Google said that its net income for the first three months of the year rose 31 percent from a year ago.
snippet: Google said that its net income for the first three months of the year rose 31 percent from a year ago.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Google said Thursday that its net income for the first three months of the year rose 31 percent on revenue growth of 42 percent from a year ago, topping estimates from Wall Street analysts.

headline.main: Google Profit Beats Wall St. Forecast
headline.print_headline: Google Profit Beats Wall St. Forecast

abstract: Google Docs Offline lets you revise your documents without a Web connection.
snippet: Google Docs Offline lets you revise your documents without a Web connection.
lead_paragraph: You don’t have to stay online to work on a Google Docs file. Google is introducing Google Docs Offline, a feature that lets you revise your documents without a Web connection. It syncs your offline changes to the Web version when you’re back online. The company has a video demonstrating the feature at www.youtube.com/google and there are detailed written instructions for using Google Docs Offline at snipurl.com/2422x.

headline.main: Tip of the Week: Editing a Google Doc, Offline

abstract: Google’s paid clicks on advertising rose by 20 percent from a year ago. Meanwhile, revenue grew a healthy 42 percent. That means that Google has found ways to rather dramatically increase the revenue it earns from each click.
snippet: Google’s paid clicks on advertising rose by 20 percent from a year ago. Meanwhile, revenue grew a healthy 42 percent. That means that Google has found ways to rather dramatically increase the revenue it earns from each click.
lead_paragraph: Google’s first-quarter results are amazingly good, given the worries on Wall Street about a slowdown in consumers clicking on its ads. (Google largely earns money only when people click on ads.)

abstract: “We like them very much,” Eric Schmidt, Google’s chief executive, said of Yahoo. But Google executives also told investors Thursday that they wanted to steal Yahoo’s biggest market: display ads on the Internet.
snippet: “We like them very much,” Eric Schmidt, Google’s chief executive, said of Yahoo. But Google executives also told investors Thursday that they wanted to steal Yahoo’s biggest market: display ads on the Internet.
lead_paragraph: Amid Microsoft’s attacks and Yahoo’s frenzied search for a defense mechanism, Eric Schmidt, the chief executive of Google, decided to play an aw-shucks Jimmy Stewart when asked about the continuing merger talks and the prospect of Google selling search ads for Yahoo.

headline.main: Google Likes Yahoo, but Wants to Steal Its Business
